intro: Dalechampia ternata var. zeylanica, commonly known as the Zeylanica var. of the genus Dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with latex-producing properties. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
